availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Benjamin T. Hibbs (Hopkins Co., Schoolteacher and 2nd Lieut. 25th inf (cons. with 17th inf))

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, schoolteacher and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of William Hibbs and Maria F. Hibbs. Student in Hopkins County in 1850. Schoolteacher in Hopkins County in 1860. Served in the 25th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a second lieutenant from January 1, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 1, p. 61A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 781.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0373.
"Benjamin T. Hibbs (1839-1910)," Find A Grave, Memorial #110622247, accessed August 10, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/110622247.
